message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) because it focuses on the use of distributed word representations and document representations for natural language processing tasks. Additionally, the paper proposes a new document analogy task for testing the semantic regularities in document representations, which is a common topic in computational linguistics research. 

The paper may also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category because document representations are often used in information retrieval systems to match queries with relevant documents. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also likely because the paper evaluates several state-of-the-art document representation models using empirical evaluations. 

The sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is possible because the paper discusses the use of neural embedding-based document representations, which is a common technique in AI research. 

Finally, the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) is possible because the paper uses neural network-based models for learning document representations.
